original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs35 billion bills post – auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 35 billion worth of treasury bills after the June 07 ,2023 auction in a phase 2 offer.
In the original auction The debt office sold all 140 billion rupees of offered securities.
The 6-month yield fell 339 basis points to 21.90 percent, along with the 12 months to 19.10 percent.
The central bank last week cut its policy rate 250 basis points in a signaling move but is not printing money to enforce the rate cut.  (Colombo/ June 09/2023)
